org.arl.fjage

Class Behavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.Behavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Behavior>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackoffBehavior, CyclicBehavior, FSMBehavior, MessageBehavior, OneShotBehavior, PoissonBehavior, TickerBehavior, WakerBehavior

    public class Behavior
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Behavior>
    Base class for agent behaviors. Commonly used behaviors are provided by subclasses:
    • CyclicBehavior for continuous behaviors
    • OneShotBehavior for one time behaviors
    • WakerBehavior for behaviors to be executed once after a specified period
    • TickerBehavior for behaviors to be executed periodically
    • BackoffBehavior for retry or backoff timeouts
    • PoissonBehavior for simulating Poisson arrival processes
    • MessageBehavior for behaviors to process incoming messages
    • TestBehavior for unit testing
    • FSMBehavior for implementing finite state machines
    Additionally, developers may create their own behaviors by extending this class or one of its subclasses.

    • Field Detail

      • agent

        protected Agent agent
        Agent owning this behavior. This attribute should not be modified by the behavior.

      • log

        protected java.util.logging.Logger log
        Logger for the behavior to log messages to. This logger defaults to the same logger as the owning agent's logger.

      • action

        protected Callback action
        If this field is not null, the default action() method calls it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Behavior

        public Behavior()

    • Method Detail

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        This method is called when a behavior is added to an agent. A behavior may customize this by overriding it.

      • onEnd

        public void onEnd()
        This method is called when a behavior is completed. A behavior may customize this by overriding it.

      • action

        public void action()
        This method is repeatedly called during the life of a behavior. A behavior may override this to provide appropriate functionality.

      • done

        public boolean done()
        This method should return true if the behavior is completed, false otherwise. A behavior should override this.
        Returns:
        true if behavior is completed, false otherwise.

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        This method should return a number that denotes the priority of a behavior. By default, the priority is 0. Behaviors with lower priority values are executed before behaviors with higher priority values.
        Returns:
        priority value

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Behavior obj)
        Implements natural ordering based on behavior priority. Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Behavior>

      • block

        public void block()
        Blocks the behavior. Blocking a behavior simply puts it in a blocked state as soon as the current action() is completed. In a blocked state, the action() method is no longer called until the behavior is unblocked by a call to restart(). Unlike Agent.block(), this method is non-blocking.

      • block

        public void block(long millis)
        Blocks the behavior for a specified period of time. Blocking a behavior simply puts it in a blocked state as soon as the current action() is completed. In a blocked state, the action() method is no longer called until the behavior is unblocked after the specified period of time or by a call to restart(). Unlike Agent.block(), this method is non-blocking.
        Parameters:
        millis - number of milliseconds before the behavior should be unblocked.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Unblocks the behavior if it was blocked.
        See Also:
        block()

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked()
        Returns true if the behavior is blocked, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the behavior is blocked, false otherwise.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets a behavior to its initial state.

      • agent

        public AgentID agent(java.lang.String name)
        Convenience method to create an owned agent id for the named agent.
        Returns:
        agent id for the named agent.

      • agentForService

        public AgentID agentForService(java.lang.String service)
        Convenience method to find an agent that provides a named service. If multiple agents are registered to provide a given service, any of the agents' id may be returned.
        Parameters:
        service - the named service of interest.
        Returns:
        an agent id for an agent that provides the service.

      • agentForService

        public AgentID agentForService(java.lang.Enum<?> service)
        Convenience method to find an agent that provides a named service. If multiple agents are registered to provide a given service, any of the agents' id may be returned.
        Parameters:
        service - the named service of interest.
        Returns:
        an agent id for an agent that provides the service.

      • agentsForService

        public AgentID[] agentsForService(java.lang.String service)
        Convenience method to find all agents that provides a named service.
        Parameters:
        service - the named service of interest.
        Returns:
        an array of agent ids representing all agent that provide the service.

      • agentsForService

        public AgentID[] agentsForService(java.lang.Enum<?> service)
        Convenience method to find all agents that provides a named service.
        Parameters:
        service - the named service of interest.
        Returns:
        an array of agent ids representing all agent that provide the service.

        Log a message at an INFO level.
